imageManagement

Class FrameSequence

  • java.lang.Object
    • imageManagement.FrameSequence

  • public class FrameSequence
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a sequence of frames (video). Provides utilities for returning a VideoCanvas (a GUI interface), individual PixelImages from the sequence (indexed by time), and single arrays of a particular x-y-position in the image over all time t. Note that your sorting algorithms--via Sorter--are used to sequence the frames.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • FrameSequence

        public FrameSequence(java.io.File dirName,
             Sorter.sortType sort)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     SequenceSummaryException
        Constructs a frame sequence given a directory name where all of the files are stored. The directory should contain a set of jpeg images, each of which has a number associated with it. All items in the directory which are not of the proper format will be ignored. The jpg files must be of the following format: fname_num.jpg They will be sequenced according to the ordering defined by num.
        Note that YOUR SORTING ALGORITHMS (via Sorter) will be used to sequence the frames.
        Example: say you have a directory "dir" with 4 files inside of it: pic_1.jpg, august_45.jpg, party_21.jpg, and format3.jpg Then the FrameSequence produced will be made up of the first three images; the last is not in the correct format and will be ignored. The frame sequence will contain: pic_1.jpg, party_21.jpg, august_45.jpg
        Parameters:
        dirName - the name of the directory to be loaded from.
        sort - the type of sorting algorithm to use to load the frame sequence.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        SequenceSummaryException

      • getImage

        public PixelImage getImage(int t)
                    throws ImageManagementException
        Returns the image which is at time t in the frame sequence. Note that frame sequences are 0-indexed (the first image is at time 0).
        Parameters:
        t - the time/index of the image to be returned.
        Returns:
        the image at index t.
        Throws:
        ImageManagementException

      • getPixletArray

        public Pixlet[] getPixletArray(int x,
                      int y,
                      Pixlet.colorType c)
                        throws ImageManagementException
        Returns the array of pixlets at position (x,y) with color c over all time (0 to max time)
        Parameters:
        x - the x position
        y - the y position
        c - the colorType of the set of pixlets to return
        Returns:
        an array of pixlets of the required color and at position (x,y) over all time t.
        Throws:
        ImageManagementException
